title: How to Change RSC Base to E27 Base (Halogen to LED)

steps.headline: Turn off the electricity to the room and test to make sure it is off
Remove the shades from the fixture.
steps.description: You may be able to just lift them out; once you get them off, set them aside.

steps.headline: Unscrew the 4 screws holding the fixture to the baseplate.
steps.description: Hold onto the fixture so it doesn't fall.

steps.headline: Take a picture or write down how the wiring is arranged.
Unscrew the marettes from the wires.
Place the fixture on a sturdy work surface.
Remove the RSC bases from the fixture.
steps.description: This light holds the RSC base on to the fixture with two screws and nuts. Unscrew these and set them aside as you will be using them at a later step

steps.headline: Use a magnet base screw holder.
steps.description: It allows you to make some visual art for fun.

steps.headline: Keep the metal brackets at the base of the RSC holders.
steps.description: They will be used later to mount the new E27 receptacles.

steps.headline: Slide the RSC bases out of the fixture.
Bend the old bracket around the new E27 base.
steps.description: The brackets will hold the receptacles place with the screws set aside earlier.

steps.headline: Test fit with the shade.
steps.description: Make sure everything clears nicely and there is no pressure anywhere.

steps.headline: Mark out two spots to drill for the mounting of the E27 receptacle.
steps.description: You will need to drill both below and above the new E27 receptacle. Make sure you use a drill bit of sufficient size which will allow the screw to pass thru without binding.

steps.headline: Mark and drill two additional spots to allow the wires to pass through to the back of the fixture.
Mount the E27 receptacles to the fixture using the screws and nuts.
steps.description: Pass the wires thru the fixture.

steps.headline: Wire the fixture in the same way it was wired before removal.
Mount the fixture back onto the baseplate on the wall.
